basics.name: Sébastien Martin
basics.label: Associate Professor
basics.summary: I am an associate professor of Operations at the Kellogg School of Management, Northwestern University. My research focuses on the interface of large-scale optimization and operations management, with applications to transportation, the gig economy, public sector operations and AI.

academic_appointments.name: Northwestern University - Kellogg
academic_appointments.summary: I teach the MBA course "AI Foundations for Managers, AgentOps".

academic_appointments.name: Northwestern University - Kellogg
academic_appointments.summary: I taught the Operations Management core course in the MBA program.

academic_appointments.name: Lyft, Inc.
academic_appointments.summary: I worked with the Marketplace Innovation Lab to improve dispatch algorithms.

industry_and_advisory.name: ESAB Corporation (NYSE: ESAB)
industry_and_advisory.summary: Member of the Board of Directors, providing strategic oversight with a focus on innovation, AI adoption, and operational excellence. ESAB is a global leader in fabrication and gas control technology ($3B revenue, 10,000 employees).

industry_and_advisory.name: ESAB Corporation (NYSE: ESAB)
industry_and_advisory.summary: I served as a strategic advisor to ESAB, working with executive leadership to develop the company's AI strategy, establish its AI steering committee, and train the workforce on leveraging AI agents for innovation and productivity.

industry_and_advisory.name: Google
industry_and_advisory.summary: Successfully passed the Google Software Engineer coding interviews. Worked for Google Maps. Researched, experimented and implemented novel algorithms to improve maps and navigation data using large geolocation datasets (> 100Gb).

awards.title: Poets and Quants Best 40 Under 40 MBA Professors
awards.summary: Awarded to 40 best business school professors under 40 years old every year

awards.title: INFORMS Journal on Computing Meritorious Reviewer Award
awards.summary: For my service as a reviewer for INFORMS Journal on Computing in 2025.

awards.title: INFORMS Journal on Computing Meritorious Reviewer Award
awards.summary: For my service as a reviewer for INFORMS Journal on Computing in 2024.

awards.title: Chair Core Course Teaching Award
awards.awarder: Kellogg School of Management, Northwestern University
awards.summary: For "teaching excellence" in Kellogg's core course Operations Management

awards.title: Transportation Science Meritorious Service Award
awards.summary: For my service as a reviewer for the journal Transportation Science.

awards.title: Distinguished Service Award, Operations Research
awards.summary: For "extraordinary reviewer work for the journal".

awards.title: Best Student Paper Award
awards.summary: For my paper "Two-Sided Flexibility in Platforms", the student is my co-author Kamessi Zhao.

awards.title: Franz Edelman Award Laureate (with Lyft)
awards.summary: Most important award for applied operations research, for my work on reinforcement learning with Lyft.

awards.title: Daniel H. Wagner Prize Finalist
awards.summary: Award for "strong mathematics applied to practical problems", for my work on platform equilibrium optimization with Lyft.

awards.title: RMP Student Paper Award Finalist
awards.summary: Award for the best student paper in revenue management and pricing for my paper on labor cost free-riding in the gig economy. The student was Zhen Lian.

awards.title: George B. Dantzig Dissertation Award
awards.summary: For my PhD dissertation. The George B. Dantzig Award is given for the best dissertation in any area of operations research and the management sciences that is innovative and relevant to practice.

awards.title: TSL dissertation prize
awards.awarder: INFORMS Transportation Science and Logistics Society
awards.summary: For my PhD dissertation. Oldest dissertation INFORMS prize, in the general area of transportation science and logistics.

awards.title: Franz Edelman Award Laureate (with Boston Public Schools)
awards.summary: Most important award for applied operations research, for my work on bus routing optimization with Boston Public Schools.

awards.title: Doing Good with Good OR award, Second Place
awards.summary: For my paper "optimizing schools’ start time and bus routes".

awards.title: Best Student Paper Award
awards.summary: For my paper "optimizing schools’ start time and bus routes".

awards.title: Best Presentation
awards.summary: For my paper "Online Vehicle Routing: The Edge of Optimization in Large-Scale Applications".

awards.title: Boston Public Schools Transportation Challenge Winner
awards.summary: Winner of a $30,000 contest to optimize school bus routes and school schedules.

awards.title: Zodiac Aerospace – Gerondeau Innovation Prize
awards.summary: Won a €10,000 prize for most innovative start-up, using machine learning to build a smart bicycle that automatically shifts gears.

awards.title: French Medal of National Defense, Bronze level
awards.summary: I received this French military honor for my cumulated time in external operations during my year of service as a military firefighter.
